intro: Dorstenia poggei var. meyeri-johannis, commonly known as the "Meyer's Dorstenia," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiraling leaves that curl tightly when dry. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. This variety is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts and is well-suited for indoor or outdoor cultivation in warm climates.
